body:
@mvadu 

Please provide the full `Imvoke-WebRequest` command you are issuing.

If you are just using `Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $Uri -Credential $Credential`, Then you will need to open an issue in CoreFX as PowerShell only passes the provided credentials to [`HttpClientHelper.Credential`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.net.http.httpclienthandler.credentials?view=netcore-2.1). That is an older style of API and unlikely to change for legacy support.

If you use `Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $Uri -Credential $Credential -Authentication Basic` That should fully support RFC-7617 https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/invoke-webrequest?view=powershell-6#optional-parameters. If that is not working properly then we have a bug here.

@markekraus  I am on latest insider version of Windows, but apparently still not on PS v6. 

```
$r = Invoke-WebRequest -Method Post -Uri "http://ubuntu:8086/query?" -Body "q=Show stats" -UseBasicParsing -ContentType $contentType -credential $(New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential($user, $(ConvertTo-SecureString $new_passwd -AsPlainText -Force))) -Authentication Basic
Invoke-WebRequest : A parameter cannot be found that matches parameter name 'Authentication'.
At line:1 char:268
+ ... SecureString $new_passwd -AsPlainText -Force))) -Authentication Basic
+                                                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (:) [Invoke-WebRequest], ParameterBindingException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NamedParameterNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand

> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.17713.1000
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.17713.1000
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

@mvadu You will need to open a [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell) issue for Windows PowerShell. This GitHub rep is only for PowerShell Core 6+ issues. As we currently have RFC-7617 support beginning with PowerShell 6.0.0, I would suggest using PowerShell 6.0.0 or newer for your code that required RFC-7617 support. You can run PowerShell Core side-by-side with Windows PowerShell 5.1.

As there appears to be no issue with PowerShell Core, I will close this issue.
